column4: maybe you want status in that dir
you probably want a command instead, though there is i .list file
but there are files like this   -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 9213 2006-04-20 19:53 /var/lib/dpkg/info/apt.list
okay, you're in need of doing some drastic surgery to the database then?  with the dangers?
sudo nano /var/lib/dpkg/status  and edit it to the format that you'll see for uninstalled apps
it's definitely not something except a last-dotch means :)
you also should try to run the preem and postrm scripts in  /var/lib/dpkg/info/foo.*  and rm the files in .list
it's prettty darn drastic, i can see no one knowing it or at least admitting :)
um, i may have been able to save you some work :)  sudo apt-get --reinstall install linux-image-whatever :)
ah, okay, well, that command for future use, heh
most should be shell scripts, sudo sh /var/lib/dpkg/info/foo.postrm
yeah, some might be bash, but they are supposed to be generic bourne shell unless they specify otherwise, i think :)  per policy
first guess, that fs needs a serious fsck, as in, maybe you powered down and it got scrambled?
do you have a separate /home partition presently?
something to consider making *if* you do end up reinstalling
